de.bright_side.filesystemfacade.facade

Class FSFFileWithInnerFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bright_side.filesystemfacade.facade.FSFFileWithInnerFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FSFFile, Comparable<FSFFile>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EncryptedFile, HistoryFile, SubDirFile

extends Object
implements FSFFile

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(FSFFile otherFile)
            throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        moves the file to the location of the other file. E.g. is this file is C:\\dir1\\myfile.txt and the other may be C:\\dir2\\moved.txt. Afterwards the FSFFile instance remains pointing to the old(!) location. This is because the file may have been moved to a different file system.
        Specified by:
        moveTo in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        otherFile - contains the location and file system where the file should be moved to
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        copies all sub-items recursively to the dest directory The dest directory may also be in a different FileSystem (e.g. you can copy from MemoryFS to NativeFS)
        Specified by:
        copyFilesTree in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        dest - the path and file system where the directory should be copied to. All sub-items of the source directory will be moved to a directory with the name provided by the dest parameter

        Exception - on error

      • getHistoryTimes

        public SortedSet<Long> getHistoryTimes()
                                throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        lists the historized versions of a file. Only HistoryFS created versions. If there are no history versions, an empty set is returned Each long value is the time when the version was created in milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        getHistoryTimes in interface FSFFile
        Returns:
        a sorted set of the history times of the file
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

      • copyHistoryFilesTree

        public void copyHistoryFilesTree(FSFFile dest,
                                 long version)
                          throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        copies all sub-items recursively to the dest directory. If the object is a file, that file is copied
        Specified by:
        copyHistoryFilesTree in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        dest - the location and file system where the history file try should be copied to
        version - history time of the archived version to be copied (as provided by "getHistoryTimes()")
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

      • getInputStreamAndVersion

        public VersionedData<InputStream> getInputStreamAndVersion()
                                                    throws Exception
        Specified by:
        getInputStreamAndVersion in interface FSFFile
        Returns:
        the version of the file and the input stream to its data. If the file system doesn't support versions, the provided version is 0
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

      • getOutputStreamForVersion

        public OutputStream getOutputStreamForVersion(boolean append,
                                              long newVersion)
                                       throws WrongVersionException,
                                              Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        gets the output stream to update a file and set the version to newVersion. If the file is new, the newVersion must be 0. If that version already exists a WrongVersionException exception is thrown. This way the file can be read by multiple threads/instances/clients/... and then updated and the updated version can be written to the file system while ensuring that no other thread/instance/client/... has made a change to that file in parallel. If the file system doesn't support versions, the newVersion field is ignored
        Specified by:
        getOutputStreamForVersion in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        append - if true the data is appended to the file. Otherwise the file is overwritten if it exists.
        newVersion - new version of the file which must be the current version of the file +1 or 0 for new files
        Returns:
        the output stream for the provided version
        Throws:
        WrongVersionException - if the version is not the current version + 1 or 0 for new files
        Exception

      • readObjectAndVersion

        public <K> VersionedData<K> readObjectAndVersion(Class<K> classType)
                                          throws Exception
        Specified by:
        readObjectAndVersion in interface FSFFile
        Type Parameters:
        K - This is the type of class
        Parameters:
        classType - the class of the object to be read
        Returns:
        the version of the file and the object stored in it. If the file system doesn't support versions, the provided version is 0
        Throws:
        Exception - on error

      • writeObjectForVersion

        public <K> FSFFile writeObjectForVersion(K objectToWrite,
                                         long newVersion)
                                  throws WrongVersionException,
                                         Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        writes the object to a file and set the version to newVersion. If the file is new, the newVersion must be 0. If that version already exists a WrongVersionException exception is thrown. This way the file can be read by multiple threads/instances/clients/... and then updated and the updated version can be written to the file system while ensuring that no other thread/instance/client/... has made a change to that file in parallel. If the file system doesn't support versions, the newVersion field is ignored
        Specified by:
        writeObjectForVersion in interface FSFFile
        Type Parameters:
        K - type the class of the object to be written
        Parameters:
        objectToWrite - the object to be written
        newVersion - new version of the file which must be the current version of the file +1 or 0 for new files
        Returns:
        the file object that was been written (to allow a cascade of method calls)
        Throws:
        WrongVersionException - if the version is not the current version + 1 or 0 for new files
        Exception - on general error

      • readBytesAndVersion

        public VersionedData<byte[]> readBytesAndVersion()
                                          throws Exception
        Specified by:
        readBytesAndVersion in interface FSFFile
        Returns:
        the file data as a byte array and the current version of the file. If the file system doesn't support versions, the provided version is 0
        Throws:
        Exception - on general error

      • writeBytesForVersion

        public FSFFile writeBytesForVersion(boolean append,
                                    byte[] bytes,
                                    long newVersion)
                             throws WrongVersionException,
                                    Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        writes the byte array to a file and set the version to newVersion. If the file is new, the newVersion must be 0. If that version already exists a WrongVersionException exception is thrown. This way the file can be read by multiple threads/instances/clients/... and then updated and the updated version can be written to the file system while ensuring that no other thread/instance/client/... has made a change to that file in parallel. If the file system doesn't support versions, the newVersion field is ignored
        Specified by:
        writeBytesForVersion in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        append - if true the data is appended to the file. Otherwise the file is overwritten if it exists.
        bytes - bytes to be written
        newVersion - new version of the file which must be the current version of the file +1 or 0 for new files
        Returns:
        the file object that was been written (to allow a cascade of method calls)
        Throws:
        WrongVersionException - if the version is not the current version + 1 or 0 for new files
        Exception - on general error

      • getVersion

        public long getVersion()
                throws Exception
        Specified by:
        getVersion in interface FSFFile
        Returns:
        the current version of the file. If the file system doesn't support versions, the provided version is 0. If the file doesn't exist the version is also 0. The version number may be read from the cache which is faster. However the cache could be outdated it the version has changed in the mean time. Use getVersion(false) to read the version without using the cache.
        Throws:
        Exception - on general error

      • getVersion

        public long getVersion(boolean allowCache)
                throws Exception
        Specified by:
        getVersion in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        allowCache - if true then the version number may be read from the cache which is faster. However the cache could be outdated it the version has changed in the mean time
        Returns:
        the current version of the file. If the file system doesn't support versions, the provided version is 0. If the file doesn't exist the version is also 0.
        Throws:
        Exception - on general error

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(long version)
                throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        If the file system supports versions, the version is set to the given value. Otherwise the command is ignored.
        Specified by:
        setVersion in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        version - the new value to be set
        Throws:
        Exception - on general error

      • writeStringForVersion

        public FSFFile writeStringForVersion(String string,
                                     long newVersion)
                              throws WrongVersionException,
                                     Exception
        Description copied from interface: FSFFile
        writes the String to a file and set the version to newVersion. If the file is new, the newVersion must be 0. If that version already exists a WrongVersionException exception is thrown. This way the file can be read by multiple threads/instances/clients/... and then updated and the updated version can be written to the file system while ensuring that no other thread/instance/client/... has made a change to that file in parallel. If the file system doesn't support versions, the newVersion field is ignored
        Specified by:
        writeStringForVersion in interface FSFFile
        Parameters:
        string - string to be written
        newVersion - new version of the file which must be the current version of the file +1 or 0 for new files
        Returns:
        the file object that was been written (to allow a cascade of method calls)
        Throws:
        WrongVersionException - if the version is not the current version + 1 or 0 for new files
        Exception - on general error
